document.docAuthor: Saboori, Alireza, Ueckermann, Edward A. & Harten, Antonius Van
document.docTitle: Solistrus mitrae Saboori, Ueckermann & Harten, 2008, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: A new genus of Neothrombiidae (Acari: Trombidioidea) from Yemen

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new genus of Neothrombiidae (Acari: Trombidioidea) from Yemen

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. Larva with the following features: fD = 44 ; fV = 8 ; fnCx = 2 - 1 - 1 ; fnTr = 1 - 1 - 1 ; fnFe = 6 - 5 - 4 ; fnGe = 4 - 2 - 2 ; fnTi = 6 - 5 - 5 ; fnTa =
12-14 - 13
; fSol = I ( 0-2 - 2 - 1 ), II ( 0-1 - 2 - 1 ), III ( 0-1 -0-0); fκ=I ( 1 - 1 ), II (0-0), III (0- 0); fζ= 2 - 1 -0; fε= 1 - 1 -0; fPp = 0-0-0-NNN 2-5 Nωζ; IP = 642 . Ta I with backwardly curved solenidion, solenidion on Ta II scoop-like.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 1 . Metric data of
Solistrus mitrae
gen. et sp. n. larvae.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Types .
The holotype (ARS- 20080126 - 1 a) and paratypes (ARS- 20080126 - 1 b, 1 c, 1 d) were collected by A. V. Harten & S. Al Haruri,
August 1999
and
November 2000
, in a light trap, in Al Kowd (
13 ° 05' N
and
45 ° 22 ' E
, altitude about 20 m a.s.l.). The holotype and one paratype (
Fig. 10
) are deposited in the Acarological Collection, Zoological Museum, College of Agriculture, University of Tehran, Karaj, Iran and two paratypes ( 1 b & 1 c in one slide) are deposited in British Museum of Natural History, London, UK .

FIGURES 5–6.

gen. et sp. nov. (larva). 5, Idiosoma, ventral view; 6, Gnathosoma, dorsal view (left) and ventral view (right).

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. The species is named after Mitra Bakhtiari Moghaddam, wife of senior author.
